titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the George F. Solomon Papers LSC.0621
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Courtney Dean, 2020.

p.date: Online finding aid last updated 2020 December 15.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-12-15 12:38:57 -0800.

did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Unprocessed collection. Material is unavailable for access. Please contact Special Collections reference (spec-coll@library.ucla.edu) for more information.
Portions of this collection are restricted. Please contact Special Collections reference (spec-coll@library.ucla.edu) for more information.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: CONTAINS UNPROCESSED AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS: [Digital/audiovisual] materials are not currently available for access and will require further processing and assessment. If you have questions about this material please email spec-coll@library.ucla.edu.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Reproduction and Use
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical objects belong to the UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], George F. Solomon papers (Collection 621). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

odd.head: UCLA Catalog Record ID
odd.p:
If you are using this field for a note other than the UCLA Catalog Record ID, use link below and change the label of the note to UCLA Catalog Record ID. If using for a general note, please delete all of this text and the label value.
UCLA Catalog Record ID: 4769635

bioghist.head: Administrative/Biographical History
bioghist.p: George F. Solomon was born on November 25, 1931 in Freeport, New York; BA and MD Stanford University (1952, 1955); held positions at Stanford University School of Medicine (1962-1973), Veterans Administration Hospital Palo Alto (1962-1970), and University of California San Francisco (1976-1983) prior to becoming professor of psychiatry and biobehavioral sciences in residence at the UCLA School of Medicine (1984-1994); research interests included: post-traumatic stress disorders in Vietnam veterans, emotional factors in onset and course of autoimmune diseases, psychoneuroimmunologic aspects of HIV / AIDS, and treatment of criminal offenders; co-founded the Psychoneuroimmunology Research Society (1993); died in Los Angeles on Oct. 7, 2001.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Cartons 2-5 include correspondence, master reprint file, speeches and presentations, audio and video tapes, and ephemera related to the activities and career of George F. Solomon.
